thread.title: Who has been LSU's most valuable player on defense so far in 2015?: Poll
thread.title_full: Who has been LSU's most valuable player on defense so far in 2015?: Poll | NOLA.com

author: Randy Rosetta, NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune
title: Who has been LSU's most valuable player on defense so far in 2015?: Poll
text:
Quietly, and not without some attention-getting blips along the way, the LSU defense has started to show positive signs of returning to the dominant level it played at in 2011.
With an Eastern Michigan foe that has generated some nice offensive numbers up next, the Tigers are allowing 306.3 yards and 21.3 points a game, which are middle-of-the-road at best in the SEC.
In particular, teams have thrown the ball with some success, averaging 196.3 yards through the air with 6 TD passes (only 2 on the ground). Part of that is a result of LSU stifling opponents' running games, with only 110 yards a contest on the ground per contest.
But right beneath the statistical surface, players are making the kind of big plays that disrupt opposing offenses and that has led to one vital fact: LSU has not trailed in a game this season.
Who do you think the Tigers' defensive MVP has been through the first month of the season?
Vote in the poll and tell us why in the comment stream below.
